title: Possible to detect an industrial civilization in geological record? (2018)
dot:
digraph SilurianHypothesis{rankdir=TB;nodesep=0.5;ranksep=0.8;node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Arial"];edge[fontname="Arial"];subgraph cluster_0{label="Main Idea";silurian[label="Silurian Hypothesis:
Can we detect traces of
previous industrial civilizations
in the geological record?"];}subgraph cluster_1{label="Motivation & Context" drake[label="Relevance to
the Drake Equation:
Multiple civilizations could
increase fc > 1"];exoplanets[label="Exoplanet Discoveries:
Most stars have planets,
many in habitable zones"];geo_limits[label="Limitations of the
Geological Record:
Incompleteness makes
detection challenging"];other_planets[label="Relevance to Other
Solar System Planets:
Mars and Venus may hold clues"];}subgraph cluster_2{label="Anthropocene Fingerprint";isotopes[label="Stable Isotope Anomalies:
Changes in C, O, H, N ratios"];sediment[label="Sedimentological Records:
Increased flow, compositional changes,
ocean acidification"];fauna[label="Faunal Changes:
Invasive species radiation,
extinctions"];synthetics[label="Synthetics:
Persistent organic pollutants,
plastics, transuranic elements"];}subgraph cluster_3{label="Past Events";PETM[label="Paleocene-Eocene
Thermal Maximum (PETM):
Abrupt warming, isotope shifts,
similar to Anthropocene"];OAE[label="Ocean Anoxic Events (OAEs):
Periods of low oxygen,
isotope excursions"];paleozoic[label="Early Mesozoic and
Late Paleozoic Events:
Extinctions, climate shifts"];}subgraph cluster_4{label="Testable Hypotheses";tests[label="Further Research:
Persistence of synthetics,
analysis of past anomalies,
search for candidate species"];}silurian->drake;silurian->exoplanets;silurian->geo_limits;silurian->other_planets;silurian->isotopes;silurian->sediment;silurian->fauna;silurian->synthetics;silurian->PETM;silurian->OAE;silurian->paleozoic;silurian->tests;}
